OVERVIEW: The Tulia series consists of very deep, well drained, moderately permeable soils that formed in loamy, calcareous eolian sediments derived mainly from the Blackwater Draw Formation of Pleistocene age. These soils are on very gently to moderately sloping plains. Slope ranges from 1 to 8 percent. The mean annual precipitation is 48 cm (18 in.) and the mean annual temperature is 15 degrees C (59 degrees F).

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Fine-loamy, carbonatic, thermic Calcidic Paleustalfs

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Tulia loam, on a gently sloping plain, 4 percent slope in native grassland at an elevation of about 1,109 m (3,640 ft). (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise stated.)
A--0 to 15 cm (0 to 6 in); dark yellowish brown (10YR 4/4) loam, dark yellowish brown (10YR 3/4) moist; weak fine subangular blocky structure; hard, friable; many fine roots and pores; few wormcasts; few small pebbles of caliche; strongly effervescent, moderately alkaline; clear smooth boundary. (10 to 30 cm [4 to 12 in] thick).
Btk1--15 to 35 cm (6 to 14 in); brown (10YR 5/3) loam, brown (10YR 4/3) moist; moderate fine subangular blocky structure parting to weak fine granular; hard, friable; many fine roots and pores; many wormcasts; common faint clay films on ped surfaces; common threads and films of calcium carbonate; few carbonate nodules; violently effervescent, moderately alkaline; gradual wavy boundary. (15 to 41 cm [6 to 16 in] thick).
Btk2--35 to 76 cm (14 to 30 in); pink (7.5YR 8/4) clay loam, pink (7.5YR 7/4) moist; weak fine subangular blocky structure; hard, friable; few wormcasts; few faint clay films on ped surfaces; many coarse masses and a few fine weakly cemented nodules of calcium carbonate; calcium carbonate equivalent about 55 percent; violently effervescent; moderately alkaline; diffuse wavy boundary. (15 to 66 cm [6 to 26 in] thick).
Btk3--76 to 114 cm (30 to 45 in); light reddish brown (5YR 6/4) clay loam, reddish brown (5YR 5/4) moist; weak fine subangular blocky structure; hard, friable; many very fine pores; few distinct clay films on ped surfaces; few coarse masses of calcium carbonate; calcium carbonate equivalent about 20 percent; violently effervescent, moderately alkaline; gradual wavy boundary. (13 to 41 cm [5 to 16 in] thick).
Bt--114 to 216 cm (45 to 85 in); reddish yellow (5YR 6/6) sandy clay loam, yellowish red (5YR 5/6) moist; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; hard, friable; few fine pores; few distinct clay films on ped surfaces; few films and threads of calcium carbonate; strongly effervescent, moderately alkaline.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Swisher County, Texas; 322 m (0.2 mile) west and 402 m (0.25 mile) south of the northeast corner of sec. 104; 3.2 km (2 miles west) and 1.6 km (1 mile north) of Tulia, Texas; Latitude: 34 degrees, 34 minutes, 18 seconds N; Longitude: 101 degrees, 59 minutes, 44 seconds W; Lakeview, Texas USGA quad; NAD 83.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Soil moisture: An ustic moisture regime bordering on aridic. The soil moisture control section is dry in some or all parts for more than 180 but less than 220 days, cumulative, in normal years.
July through August and December through February are the driest months. These soils are intermittently moist in September through November and March through June.
Mean annual soil temperature: 15 to 18 degrees C (59 to 64 degrees F) Depth to calcic horizon: 15 to 51 cm (5 to 20 in.) thick
Calcium carbonate equivalent in control section: 40 to 60 percent Solum thickness: more than 203 cm (80 in.) thick
Particle-size control section: 20 to 35 percent silicate clay
A horizon:
Hue: 5YR to 10YR
Value: 4 to 6 dry, 3 to 5 moist
Chroma: 2 to 4
Note: If moist value and chroma are less than 3.5, the horizon is less than 18 cm (7 in  thick).
Texture: fine sandy loam, loam, or clay loam
Effervescence: strong or violent
Reaction: moderately alkaline
Upper Btk horizons: Hue: 5YR to 10YR
Value: 6 to 8 dry, 5 to 7 moist
Chroma: 2 to 4
Texture: loam or clay loam
Visible secondary calcium carbonate: 30 to 70 percent by volume in the form of films, threads, masses, and nodules.
Calcium carbonate equivalent: 20 to 60 percent Effervescence: violent
Reaction: moderate to strongly alkaline
Lower Btk horizons: Hue: 5YR to 7.5YR
Value: 5 to 7 dry, 4 to 6 moist
Chroma: 4 to 6
Texture: loam, clay loam, or sandy clay loam
Visible secondary calcium carbonate: 15 to 50 percent by volume in the form of films, threads, masses, and nodules.
Calcium carbonate equivalent: 10 to 40 percent Effervescence: violent
Reaction: moderate to strongly alkaline
Bt horizon:
Hue: 2.5YR to 7.5YR
Value: 5 or 6 dry, 4 or 5 moist
Chroma: 6 to 8
Texture: sandy clay loam or clay loam
Visible secondary calcium carbonate: few films, threads, and fine nodules. Calcium carbonate equivalent: 10 to 30 percent
Effervescence: violent
Reaction: moderate to strongly alkaline

COMPETING SERIES.content:
COMPETING SERIES: There are no competing series. Similar soils include the Arch, Bovina,, Mansker, Ple mo ns, Posey, and Veal series.
Arch and Veal soils do not have an argillic horizon.
Bovina and Mansker soils have mollic epipedons.
Plemons and Posey soils have mixed mineralogy.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Parent material: Loamy, calcareous sediments derived mainly from eolian sediments of the Blackwater Draw Formation of Pleistocene age
Landform: very gently to moderately sloping plains adjacent to draws or escarpments Slopes: Dominantly 1 to 5 percent, but ranges to 8 percent
Mean annual air temperature: 14 to 17 degrees C (57 to 62 degrees F). Mean annual precipitation: 43 to 53 cm (17 to 21 in)
Frost-free period: 180 to 220 days
Thornthwaite annual P-E Index Values: 30 to 34.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content:
GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS: These are the similar Estacado, Mansker, and  Posey series, and the Acuff, Amarillo, Berda, Olt on, Potter, and Pullman series.
Estacado, Mansker, and Posey soils are on similar landscape positions.
Acuff and Amarillo soils are on slightly higher landscape positions have mixed soil mineralogy, and the depth to a calcic horizon is between 76 and 152 cm (30 to 60 in).
Berda soils are on lower landscape positions and have mixed soil mineralogy and a cambic horizon.
Olton and Pullman soils are on slightly higher landscape positions and have mixed soil mineralogy and a mollic epipedon.
Potter soils are on slightly lower landscape positions and have a loamy-skeletal particle-size class.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY: Well drained; moderate permeability; surface runoff is low on 1 to 5 percent slopes, and moderate on 5 to 8 percent slopes.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION: Primarily used for rangeland. Where cultivated, the principal crops are grain sorghum, small grains, and forage crops. Climax vegetation is mainly mid and short grasses and includes blue grama, sideoats grama, and buffalograss, with lesser amounts of vine-mesquite, western wheatgrass, galleta or tobosa, silver bluestem, wild alfalfa, and prairie clover with a light to moderate overstory of mesquite. This soil has been correlated to the Deep Hardland (R077CY022TX) range site in MLRA-77C.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT: Southern High Plains of Texas (MLRA 77C in LRR H). The series is of moderate extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Temple, Texas

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS: This soil was formerly included in the Veal and Mansker series. Diagnostic horizons and features recognized in this pedon are:
Ochric epipedon: 0 to 15 cm (0 to 6 in) (A horizon)
Argillic horizon: 15 to 216 cm (6 to 85 in) (Btk1, Btk2, Btk2,
Bt horizons)
Calcic horizon: 36 to 114 cm (14 to 45 in) (Btk2, Btk3 horizons)
ADDITIONAL DATA: 99TX153002 (Floyd County, Texas).
Taxonomic Version: Keys to Soil Taxonomy, Twelfth Edition, 2014.
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.

HORIZONS.name: A
HORIZONS.narrative: A--0 to 15 cm (0 to 6 in); dark yellowish brown (10YR 4/4) loam, dark yellowish brown (10YR 3/4) moist; weak fine subangular blocky structure; hard, friable; many fine roots and pores; few wormcasts; few small pebbles of caliche; strongly effervescent, moderately alkaline; clear smooth boundary. (10 to 30 cm [4 to 12 in] thick).

HORIZONS.name: Btk1
HORIZONS.narrative: Btk1--15 to 35 cm (6 to 14 in); brown (10YR 5/3) loam, brown (10YR 4/3) moist; moderate fine subangular blocky structure parting to weak fine granular; hard, friable; many fine roots and pores; many wormcasts; common faint clay films on ped surfaces; common threads and films of calcium carbonate; few carbonate nodules; violently effervescent, moderately alkaline; gradual wavy boundary. (15 to 41 cm [6 to 16 in] thick).

HORIZONS.name: Btk2
HORIZONS.narrative: Btk2--35 to 76 cm (14 to 30 in); pink (7.5YR 8/4) clay loam, pink (7.5YR 7/4) moist; weak fine subangular blocky structure; hard, friable; few wormcasts; few faint clay films on ped surfaces; many coarse masses and a few fine weakly cemented nodules of calcium carbonate; calcium carbonate equivalent about 55 percent; violently effervescent; moderately alkaline; diffuse wavy boundary. (15 to 66 cm [6 to 26 in] thick).

HORIZONS.name: Btk3
HORIZONS.narrative: Btk3--76 to 114 cm (30 to 45 in); light reddish brown (5YR 6/4) clay loam, reddish brown (5YR 5/4) moist; weak fine subangular blocky structure; hard, friable; many very fine pores; few distinct clay films on ped surfaces; few coarse masses of calcium carbonate; calcium carbonate equivalent about 20 percent; violently effervescent, moderately alkaline; gradual wavy boundary. (13 to 41 cm [5 to 16 in] thick).

HORIZONS.name: Bt
HORIZONS.narrative: Bt--114 to 216 cm (45 to 85 in); reddish yellow (5YR 6/6) sandy clay loam, yellowish red (5YR 5/6) moist; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; hard, friable; few fine pores; few distinct clay films on ped surfaces; few films and threads of calcium carbonate; strongly effervescent, moderately alkaline.
